content.description: A raffle for a charity fund-raiser is being planned. Each of <math alttext="2000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2000</mn></math> raffle tickets will be sold for <math alttext="$1.00" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>1.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The holders of <math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> winning tickets will each win a prize. The table shows the prize values and the number of prizes for each value.
content.question: Prize Value Number of Prizes <math alttext="$25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>$</mtext><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>$50</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$300" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> The random variable <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> represents the value of the prize won for a single ticket minus the cost of the ticket. What is the expected value of <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math>?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.8: Mean and Standard Deviation of Random Variables

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
